data.title: L System
data.statement:
Your objective is to code a L-System. A L-System is a recursive rule-based system where, for a given entry string, each iteration will replace some subset of characters to another subset.

For instance, The Peano-Hilbert curve is a L-System with the following rules :

A -> "−BF+AFA+FB−"
B -> "+AF−BFB−FA+"

Starting from the axiom A, the first two iterations of this L-System gives :

0: A
1: −BF+AFA+FB−
2: -+AF−BFB−FA+F+−BF+AFA+FB−F−BF+AFA+FB−+F+AF−BFB−FA+-

You have to code a system that, given a set of rules, computes the N first iterations of the L-System
data.stubGenerator:
read nrules:int
read nite:int
read axium:word(1)
loop nrules read axiom:word(1) substitution:word(100)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
nrules the number of substitution rules
nite the number of iterations to compute
axiom the base axiom
nrules lines with two strings AXIOM SUBSTITUTION indicating the substitution rule for the axiom
data.outputDescription: nite lines corresponding to every iterations of the L-System

lastVersion.statementHTML:
The program:
Your objective is to code a L-System. A L-System is a recursive rule-based system where, for a given entry string, each iteration will replace some subset of characters to another subset.

For instance, The Peano-Hilbert curve is a L-System with the following rules :

A -> "−BF+AFA+FB−"
B -> "+AF−BFB−FA+"

Starting from the axiom A, the first two iterations of this L-System gives :

0: A
1: −BF+AFA+FB−
2: -+AF−BFB−FA+F+−BF+AFA+FB−F−BF+AFA+FB−+F+AF−BFB−FA+-

You have to code a system that, given a set of rules, computes the N first iterations of the L-System
INPUT:
nrules the number of substitution rules
nite the number of iterations to compute
axiom the base axiom
nrules lines with two strings AXIOM SUBSTITUTION indicating the substitution rule for the axiom

OUTPUT:
nite lines corresponding to every iterations of the L-System

EXAMPLE:
Input
2
3
A
A -BF+AFA+FB-
B +AF-BFB-FA+
Output
A
-BF+AFA+FB-
-+AF-BFB-FA+F+-BF+AFA+FB-F-BF+AFA+FB-+F+AF-BFB-FA+-
